review: and this product provides a solution:video streaming from a main server to eliminate running new cabling in an older homewe live in a digital ghetto, surrounded by FIOS and high-speed cable - but we can only get less than 1Mbps DSL and wifi cellular connections are too expensivethis product provides a way for for us to stream movies and music from a stationary server in the house (an iMac) to our HDTVs placed around our home - and to do it wirelessly!very clean, very easy to set up:1. attach an AppleTV to each HDTV2. configure each to connect to your wifi router3. set up VNC (RDP) on your iMac4. sit in front of the desired TV5. initiate a VNC session from a netbook into your iMac (i use low-compression/quality settings which seem good enough)6. log in, then remotely select the desired AppleTV from the Finder's AirPlay menu7. launch VLC to play your movie8. eat popcornmost 'normal' AppleTV users will use their high-speed Internet to watch streams or info through a pay wall, but if you're like me and live in a digital ghetto, the AppleTV provides a way to conduct media sessions and enjoy entertainment in a closeted garden!

review: I used to use my blu ray player for watching Netflix and Hulu and listening to music.  But I always hated how slow it was in loading those apps.  I invested in one of these around Christmas and haven't used my Blu Ray player since.  I've even gotten to buying digital movies because it's so much easier than having to fiddle through your blu ray disc collection. The only downside to this is that it doesn't automatically play the next episode if you're watching a series on hulu or Netflix.  You have to click back, scroll down to the next episode, and hit play.  It's not like the app on the ps3 that does all of that for you.  But I can live that so, I'm good.
